title: Feature request: Import from a simple text list
author: yllekz
body_snippet:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->
I cannot import from AD (program hangs/crashes) nor a port scan (security reasons), but I can query PowerShell and get a list of servers. The import options don't seem to support importing from a simple txt file, and trying to build a CSV file in the format that it's requesting seems to require uniquely generated random IDs, which I'm not sure if I can just randomly generate them myself.

I was looking at this this morning.  I have a working case based on seeing no headers in a csv file.  However, the main problem is determining if the connection type is SSH or RDP.  There are a few options for how to detect it, in order of most difficult to simplest:

1. File name specific, e.g. ssh.csv or rdp.csv, or some variant.
2. Each line contains a port, e.g. hostname:22 or hostname:3389
3. First line contains the word ssh or rdp
4. Assuming all ssh or rdp
